body_html:
@apaszke ,
For my case, torch.cuda.is_available() returns True.
However, I get this error while converting a variable into cuda.

What can be the issue ?

torch.cuda.is_available()
Out[8]: True

x = x.cuda()
Traceback (most recent call last):

File "", line 1, in
x = x.cuda()

File "/home/research/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/_utils.py", line 58, in _cuda
with torch.cuda.device(device):

AttributeError: module 'torch' has no attribute 'cuda'

body:
@apaszke ,
For my case, torch.cuda.is_available() returns True. 
However, I get this error while converting a variable into cuda. 

What can be the issue ?
--------------------------------------------

torch.cuda.is_available()
Out[8]: True

x = x.cuda()
Traceback (most recent call last):

  File "<ipython-input-9-ad449046b139>", line 1, in <module>
    x = x.cuda()

  File "/home/research/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/_utils.py", line 58, in _cuda
    with torch.cuda.device(device):

AttributeError: module 'torch' has no attribute 'cuda'
